{{moresources|date=November 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox university | name = Jagan Institute of Management Studies | image = [[File:JIMS Rohini Logo.jpg|120px]] | established = 1993 | type = [[Business school|Self Financing Institution]] | affiliation = AICTE, AIU, NBA,GGSIPU | undergrad = 720 [[BBA]], [[Bachelor of Computer Application|BCA]] | postgrad = 960 [[PGDM]], [[PGDM-IB]], [[PGDM-RM]], [[Master of Computer Applications|MCA]] | students = 1600+ | chairman = [http://jimsindia.org/Chairman_Message.aspx Manish Gupta] | director = Dr. Pawan Gupta | city = [[Delhi]] | state = [[Delhi]] | country = [[India]] | website = [http://www.jimsindia.org www.jimsindia.org] }} '''Jagan Institute of Management Studies, Sector-5, Rohini''' is a [[List of business schools in Asia#India|business school]] in Northern [[India]]. It imparts professional education both at undergraduate level and postgraduate level in the fields of management and technology. It was established in 1993. [[File:Jagan institute of management studies rohini.jpg|thumb|Jagan Institute of Management Studies (JIMS) official Building Pic.]] [[File:Chairman msg.jpg|thumb|Mr. Manish Gupta - Chairman, JIMS Rohini]] == Rankings == *Jagan Institute of Management Studies, Sector 5, Rohini is accredited with 'A' grade by NAAC (National Assessment and Accreditation Council)<ref>https://jimsindia.org/institute.aspx</ref> *JIMS Rohini attained 43rd spot in the management category in a list of top 50 institutions on an all India basis. - National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2016 *Ranked 7th in Delhi/NCR and 36th in All India Ranking for Top Private Business Schools in India2016 - Business World 2016<ref>https://jimsindia.org/jims-top-mba-colleges.aspx</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
== Programmes offered == * PGDM * PGDM-International Business * PGDM-Retail Management * MCA * BBA * BCA
== Other institutions == JIMS group has started two Universities. One is in [[Jaipur]] and another one is at [[State Highway 22 (Haryana)]]. Total ten educational College and Universities are running under Jagan Nath Gupta educational Society..
== Infrastructure == The institute is located in Rohini, in north-west part of Delhi.
==External links== *[http://www.jimsindia.org Official website of JIMS] *[http://www.slideshare.net/JimsIndia/frauds-33967656 Default Identification and Prevention of Frauds in International Business (JIMS in association with FIEO)]

{{Multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=February 2016}} {{advert|date=February 2012}} }}
[[Junior Achievement]] (JA) was founded in 1919 by [[Theodore Vail]], president of [[American Telephone & Telegraph]]; Horace Moses, president of Strathmore Paper Co.; and Senator Murray Crane of [[Massachusetts]]. Its first program, The Company Program, was offered to [[high school]] students on an after-school basis. In 1975, the organization entered the classroom with the introduction of Project Business for the middle grades. Since then, Junior Achievement has gradually expanded its activities and broadened its scope to encompass an ever-widening student population.
Junior Achievement of South Florida<ref>[http://www.jasouthflorida.org Junior Achievement of South Florida]</ref> was founded locally in 1959 by the [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida|Fort Lauderdale]] [[Rotary Club]] and served just 373 high school students during its first year. Programs now span grades K-12, with [[age appropriate]] curricula designed to teach [[Elementary school|elementary students]] about their roles as individuals, workers, and consumers and to prepare middle grade and high school students for key economic and workforce issues they will face. Junior Achievement programs reached 44,000 [[Broward County, Florida|Broward]] and [[Palm Beach County, Florida|South Palm Beach County]] students during the 2009-2010 [[school year]].
==Programs==
Junior Achievement of South Florida offers age-appropriate curricula to ensure that students understand their roles as future members of the business community. The programs are divided into three categories: elementary, [[middle school]] and [[high school]].
===Elementary===
The elementary school programs include six sequential themes for [[kindergarten]] through fifth-grade students and one capstone experience. Students learn the basic concepts of [[business]] and economics and how education is relevant to the workplace. The activities build on studies from each preceding grade and prepare students for secondary school and continued learning. Fifth graders can have the opportunity to work at JA BizTown, a facility on the [[Broward College]] campus.
===Middle School===
The middle school programs emphasize the value of workforce readiness, entrepreneurship, and [[financial literacy]].<ref>Tyko, Kelly. "Treasure Coast educators get look at Junior Achievement center" [http://www.tcpalm.com/news/2011/jan/14/treasure-coast-educators-get-good-look-at-junior/?partner=yahoo_feeds]</ref> Students are also introduced to many economic concepts and facts about the working world.
The programs in this level expand upon the concepts that were learned in elementary school and help teens make good decisions about their futures. Junior Achievement’s lessons are meant to supplement standard [[social studies]] curricula and develop [[communication skills]]. 8th graders have the opportunity to work beyond JA BizTown to JA Finance Park, also on the [[Broward College]] campus.
===High School===
The high school programs teach students about concepts relating to entrepreneurship, financial literacy, and [[work readiness]]. Students are encouraged to make informed decisions about their future, and foster skills that will be useful in the business world. Volunteers aid in these goals by bringing real-life business experience into the classroom, which reinforce the lessons that are taught.
==JA World Huizenga Center at Broward College==
Since its inception, Junior Achievement has been committed to "[[experiential learning]]." Taking it to the next level, Junior Achievement of South Florida created the [http://www.floridatrend.com/life_article.asp?cName=Lifestyle&rName=Lifestyle+Features&whatID=1&aID=51599&aID2=47918 JA World Huizenga center] at [[Broward College]] that houses two new programs: JA BizTown and JA Finance Park. This dramatic shift forward will significantly transform how every local student is taught to view the world of work, [[free enterprise]] and their possibilities for success in it. Through the experiential learning derived from both BizTown and Finance Park, students achieve advanced levels of engagement, reflection, and personal responsibility.
===JA BizTown===
JA BizTown is a miniature city that allows fifth-graders the opportunity to assume roles as proprietors, civic leaders, and consumers. It greatly increases students’ knowledge of the free enterprise system as they learn how to fulfill the goals of satisfying customers, paying-off business loans, and realizing a profit at the conclusion of the business day.
===JA Finance Park===
JA Finance Park expands upon the lessons learned in JA BizTown by giving students an identity to manage that includes marital status, number of children, annual income, education attained, and job type. Students take these characteristics into consideration as they prepare budgets that take into consideration housing, food, furniture, insurance, education, automobiles, [[investment]]s, and more. Providing a real life experience of managing an [[income]] and learning to live within your means offers a strong and important lesson on the value of staying in school to maximize earning potential.
== References == <!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}}
== External links == * Official site, [http://www.jasouthflorida.org Junior Achievement of South Florida]

revision.text:
{{advert|date=June 2015}} {{no footnotes|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Kailash Chandra Mishra | image = | alt = | caption = | other_names = KCM | occupation = Institution Builder | birth_date = {{birth-date and age|25 March 1951|df=yes}} | birth_place = Sri Ramchandra Pur, Puri, Orissa, India }}
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2014}} Dr '''Kailash Chandra Mishra''' is known as a management teacher, [[orator]], researcher and writer. He relocated from the [[Lal Bahadur Shastri Institute of Management]], Delhi to take over as the first Vice Chancellor of [[Sri Sri University]] in Orissa founded by [[Sri Sri Ravishankar]] with patronage from Government of Odisha. The saga of his institution building is not without hurdles but the final outcome is in the interest of society.
== Books ==
His books include ''The Game is changing: Insurance Reloaded''; ''Insurance Demystified: Reading beyond the lexicon''; ''Medical Informatics: An exploration''; ''Finance for family managed business and Financial Management: In the era of reforms''. He is a newspaper columnist and used to write a column every Saturday in [[DNA (newspaper)|DNA]] – Money – Comments. He has more than three hundred published papers in various national and international management journals. In 2008 he has published eight textbooks through Cengage learning (Previously Thomson learning) in New Delhi. These books include: ''Insurance Business Environment and Insurance Company operations''; ''Life Insurance : Principles & Practice''; ''General Insurance : Principles & Practice''; ''Financial Management & Insurance Accounting''; ''Elements of Actuarial Science''; ''Legal & Regulatory Aspects of Insurance''; ''Basics of Personal Financial Planning''; and ''Life Insurance Underwriting''. Each of these books was coauthored by one of his doctoral students or management associates. He has also published in 2008 two other books through ICFAI Publication, namely "Enjoying IIT-Jee" and Organizational Adaptation – A tag study of General Insurance TAC in India". In April 2011 he gave the ninth Odisha Swaviman Lecture "Orissa Civil Society Begs for a Shake", which was published as an Oriya book by the NGO ''Āma Oḍishā'' in Bhubaneswar.
== Management frameworks ==
He is credited with creating cited management frameworkslike "Mishra's Seven A framework of insurance management", first published in his book ''Insurance Reloaded'' ICFAI Publication, Hyderabad, India, "APES framework for insurance organization", first published in USA, Chamber and Partners' journal ''Mondaq.com'', "Mishra theory of preference dynamics in investment", first cited in his D.Litt. thesis "Mutual Funds in the emerging market", "Seven P framework of underwriting", first published in "Asia Insurance Post, Mumbai, india and "3L framework of retrocession planning", first published in the journal "Bima Quest", Pune, India.
== Extramural innovations ==
In various management schools he has founded, he has introduced some extramurals like BEAD (Business Etics Advancement and Development), MID (Management Intrapreneurship Development), STUDENT (Structuring The Unstructured by Discussion, Evolution, Negotiation and Training), POY (Power of You) and INLAB (Insurance Laboratory). At SPJIMR, ASCI and NIASOM, he introduced the concept of self-audit for management students – where the students takes responsibility for a part of his syllabus, topic, teacher, examination and examiner. Students' participation in management of business school is his avowed ideal. When enquired as to why he has not started any further experimentation at [[Lal Bahadur Shastri Institute of Management]] (LBSIM), of which he was the Director, he has an interesting response. Lal Bahadur Shastri's Himalayan legacy runs at LBSIM. [[Lal Bahadur Shastri]] was known for his simplicity, honesty, integrity and assertiveness. Anyone understanding these values and internalizing the principles as a way of life does not need any further extramurals. At [[Sri Sri University]] he has introduced a concept for management students called ADLOP (Assessment and Development of Leadership and Outreach Potential).
== Academics ==
By qualification he is MSc in [[solid-state physics]] with three gold medals, [[MBA]], CAIIB and Doctor of Literature ([[D.Litt]])in [[Managerial finance|Financial Management]]. In 2001, International Biographer's Association gave him the Best Citizen of India award (he was one of the ten recipients).
== Institution building ==
He has contributed largely to organizations like [[Bank of India]], S P Jain Institute of Management and Research, Administrative Staff College of India, National Insurance Academy, Loss Prevention Association of India, Maharashtra State Cooperative Deposit Guarantee Corporation, Unit Trust of India Asset Management Company, UTI Ventures and Doha Bank Assurance Company. He has been a visiting Professor at international universities like [[Columbia University]], [[University of Connecticut]], [[CPCU]] Atlanta, [[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania|Wharton]]'s Aresty Business School, [[Yale University]], S P JAIN CENTER OF MANAGEMENT (Dubai & Singapore), and [[Manchester Business School]], among others. He took charge of first whistle blowing Ombudsperson of Mutual Funds at UTI. He was appointed by Government of India to be a special invitee equivalent of a Board member for CAG Audit of PSU Insurance Companies – the finding is available at CAG website as submitted to the President of India. Another institution he holds is Technical Director of Doha Bank Assurance Company and Audit Committee Chairman of the company, which is regulated by Qatar Financial Services Authority (QFSA). He was also technical director of a venture capital company at Bengaluru (UVS) and advisor to the chairman situated in UK of one of the largest MNC intermediary Marsh with office in India. He is an expert committee member of EPFO for pension reforms and is also associated with RBI and SEBI in regulatory best practices. This makes him one of the most versatile experts in financial sector of India. As the Director of LBSIM, he also used to oversee other activities associated with Lal Bahadur Shastri Trust, most important of which is Lal Bahadur Shastri Research Centre (LBSRC) undertaking public policy research both at National and international levels. He is engaged in establishing Sri Sri University in Orissa which is declared by the spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravishankar to recreate the ethos of ancient Indian Universities like Nalanda and Rajgiri with Modern teaching learning facilities.
== Progression ==
Dr Mishra is from a village called Sriramachandrapur in [[Puri]], a district of [[Orissa, India|Orissa]]. Currently he advises several ministries of the [[Government of India]] and he has advised eight different ministries of the Government of India in the past. His concern for [[Micro finance]] and micro-insurance have been his strongest points apart from professional management education. In May 2008 Dr Mishra was appointed as a member of Planning Commission of India subgroup on Weather Insurance for Agriculture. As first vice chancellor of Sri Sri University, he has a task to recreate the ethos of ancient Indian Universities like Nalanda and Rajgiri as per vision enunciated by the spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravishankar.
== LBS National Award in India ==
[[File:LBSAWARD.jpg|thumb]] [[File:LBSAWARDEE.jpg|thumb]]
Dr Mishra has the privilege of initiating LBS National award for 2009 on behalf of [[Lal Bahadur Shastri Institute of Management]] for Excellence in Public Administration, Academics and Management started in the nineties by the initiative of former union minister Mr Anil shastri, the son of Shri Lal Bahadur Shastri. The picture here shows Dr Mishra requesting the President of India to bestow the award for 2009 to Mr Sunil Bharti Mittal, the owner of largest telecom company in India.
[http://www.lbsim.ac.in]
One of the greatest national effort in India for ensuring inclusiveness in growth and providing much needed rural employment is MahaNREGA (Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act). On 3 February 2010 Dr K C Mishra organized the submission of NREGA research report to the Vice President of India Mr Hamid Ansari.
[[File:NAREGAVP.jpg|thumb]] [[File:NAREGAREPORT.jpg|thumb]]
Dr Shashi Tharoor, Former Union State External Affairs Minister of India discusses the developmental role of India in ensuring Regional peace and prosperity. Sharing the dias are Mr Anil Shastri, Mr Sunil Shastri and Dr K C Mishra.
[[File:Regionalpeace1.jpg|thumb]]
Lal Bahadur Shastri was second prime minister of India. LBS National Award is given every year at President's House of India a day before birth day of Mahatma Gandhi and Lal Bahadur Shastri. Tenth LBS National Award was conferred on Mrs Aruna Roy, the pioneer for Right to Information Act and activist for woman empowerment in rural India as also ensuring food security for poor. Dr K C Mishra conducts the function in President's House on 1 October 2010.
[[File:lbs10-kcm-bowing.jpg|thumb]]
After bowing to the President of India Dr Mishra seeks President's permission to initiate the national award function:
[[File:lbs10-kcm-permission.jpg|thumb]]
10th LBS National Awardee Mrs Aruna Roy delivers the acceptance speech with President Mrs Pratibha Patil, Anil Shastri (Son of Lal Bahadur Shastri), Christy Fernandes (Secretary to President) and Dr Kailash Chandra Mishra are in dias;
[[File:lbs10-dias-president.jpg|thumb]]
President of India offers photo opportunity to National Awardee with Dr Kailash Chandra Mishra and Mr Anil Shastri as dignitaries look on:
[[File:lbs10-awardee-aruna.jpg|thumb]]
National Insurance Academy bids farewell to Silver Jublee with the visit of the then President of India Dr A P J Abdul Kalam who is led to the Open Air Theatre by Dr K C Mishra as the then Director:
[[File:crossing-nia-bridge.jpg|thumb]]
Silver Jublee speech by Dr K C Mishra appraised by President Dr Abdul Kalam, the then Chief Minister of Maharashtra Vilas Rao Deshmukh and others:
[[File:Silver-jubilee-nia.jpg|thumb]]
Dr K C Mishra in an intimate discussion with the then President of India Dr Abdul Kalam:
[[File:discussion-president.jpg|thumb]]
Dr K C Mishra receives blessings of the Dalai Lama on 7 January 2011 at National Museum, Delhi:
[[File:Dalai Lama accepts a replica from Dr Kailash Chandra Mishra, Delhi National Museum, 7.1.2011 .jpg|thumb]]
Dalai Lama received by dignitaries – Dr K C Mishra says namaskar:
[[File:The Dalai Lama received by Dr. K. C. Mishra at Delhi National Museum, 07.01.2011.jpg|thumb]]
President of India Smt Prativa Devi Patil and Chief Minister of Delhi Smt Sheila Dikhsit inaugurated Lal Bahadur Shastri Institute of Management, Dwarka Campus on 23 February 2011 five days before Dr K C Mishra relinquished the Directorship of the Institute to pursue a career aimed at setting up a spiritually robust University in Orissa sponsored by the Spiritual Leader Sri Sri Ravishankar.
[[File:kcmishra-pezindia-cmdelhi.jpg|thumb]]
A picture of Dr K C Mishra and his spouse with Chief Minister of Delhi Smt Sheila Dikshit to peruse a show on life and times of Second Prime Minister of India Shri Lal Bahadur Shastri
[[File:kcm-spouse-cmdelhi.jpg|thumb]]
A picture of Dr K C Mishra with spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravishankar and former WIPRO COO Dr A L Rao announcing the developments of Sri Sri University
[[File:kcm-SSU-BBSR.jpg|thumb]]
A picture of Dr K C Mishra with spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravishankar of Art of Living fame at Sri Sri University where Dr Mishra's spouse is also present

{{Infobox person | birthname= Lapo Edovard Elkann{{cite web|url=http://relationshipscience.com/lapo-edovard-elkann-p52415783|title=Lapo Edovard Elkann, Founder at Italia Independent Group SpA - Relationship Science|website=Relationship Science|accessdate=10 January 2018}} | image = | parents = [[Count]]ess Margherita Agnelli de Pahlen
[[Alain Elkann]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1977|10|7|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[New York City]] | occupation = President, [[Italia Independent]]
president, Independent Ideas, founding partner, LA Holding
director of brand promotion, [[Fiat Group]] | known_for = Grandson of [[Gianni Agnelli]], nephew of [[Umberto Agnelli]], cousin of ''Donna'' [[Bianca Brandolini d’Adda]], }} '''Lapo Edovard Elkann''' (born 7 October 1977) is an [[Italy|Italian]] businessman and grandson of [[Gianni Agnelli]], the former controlling CEO and controlling shareholder of [[Fiat Automobiles]]. ==Background== A member of the [[Agnelli family]], Elkann was born in New York City, the son of [[Countess]] Margherita Agnelli de Pahlen and the [[United States|American]]-born Italian writer [[Alain Elkann]]. His father is [[Jewish]] and his mother is [[Catholic]].[http://www.ctv.ca/generic/generated/static/business/article2317677.html]{{dead link|date=July 2013}}{{cite web |url=https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=it&tl=en&js=n&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&layout=2&eotf=1&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.marieclaire.it%2FAttualita%2FLapo-Elkann&act=url |title=Lapo Elkann: Ritratto/intervista dell'imprenditore trentenne che odia le mezze misure. |trans-title=Portrait / interview thirty year old entrepreneur who hates half measures. |publisher=Marie Claire.it |date= |accessdate=2013-07-06 |language=Italian}}{{cite web|author=Peephole |url=https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=it&tl=en&js=n&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&layout=2&eotf=1&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.gossipblog.it%2Fpost%2F10198%2Flapo-elkann-vuole-essere-ebreo-e-diventare-un-bravo-padre&act=url |title=Lapo Elkann vuole essere ebreo e diventare un bravo padre |trans-title=Lapo Elkann wants to be jew and become a good father |publisher=Gossipblog |date=2009-08-24 |accessdate=2013-07-06 |language=Italian}} He is the brother of [[John Elkann]], the current chairman of Fiat and the chairman and [[CEO]] of [[Exor (company)|Exor]], an investment company controlled by the Agnelli family, which owns [[Juventus F.C.]]. Elkann is a grandson of [[Fiat]] chairman [[Gianni Agnelli]] and [[Marella Agnelli]]. He is nephew of Don [[Carlo Caracciolo]], founder of [[Gruppo Editoriale L’Espresso]] - owner of the newspaper ''[[la Repubblica]]'', the Italian daily general-interest newspaper.{{Cite news |title=C. Caracciolo, 83, a Publisher and La Repubblica Founder, Is Dead |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/17/world/europe/17caracciolo.html |newspaper=The New York Times |date=2008-12-17 |access-date=2015-09-06 |issn=0362-4331 |first=Elisabetta |last=Povoledo}} Elkann is also a stepson of Russian [[Russian nobility|nobleman]] [[Count]] Sergei de Pahlen.[http://www.vanityfair.com/style/features/2008/08/agnelli200808 Seal, Mark: "The Woman Who Wanted the Secrets," ''Vanity Fair'', August 2008] In addition to his brother John, Elkann has a sister, [[Ginevra Elkann]], and five half-siblings by his mother's second marriage (Maria, Pierre, Sophia, Anna, and Tatiana). He is also a great-grandnephew of [[Ettore Ovazza]], of the Ovazza banking family, via his grandmother, Carla Ovazza.{{Cite web |title=Lapo Elkann {{!}} Official Site |url=http://lapoelkann.com |website=lapoelkann.com |accessdate=2015-10-01 |first=Unbit s.a.s. - |last=unbit.it}}{{Self-published source|date=November 2016}} ==Career== In 2001, Elkann worked as a [[personal assistant]] to [[Henry Kissinger]], subsequently working as marketing associate for [[Ferrari]] and [[Maserati]]. In 2003, he became Fiat's director of marketing. He coordinated marketing for the [[Fiat Punto]] and [[Fiat 500]].{{cite news|author=Barbie Latza Nadeau |url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/newsweek/2011/11/27/playboy-industrialist-lapo-elkann-wants-to-remake-italy-s-image.html |title=Playboy Industrialist Lapo Elkann Wants to Remake Italy's Image |publisher=The Daily Beast |date=2011-11-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111129002951/http://www.thedailybeast.com/newsweek/2011/11/27/playboy-industrialist-lapo-elkann-wants-to-remake-italy-s-image.html |archivedate=2011-11-29}} Elkann left Fiat in 2005 after being widely reported as having a serious cocaine and heroin overdose, creating [[Italia Independent]], a lifestyle and clothing brand featuring Italian products.[https://howtospendit.ft.com/vehicles/5893-tales-from-lapoland "Tales from Lapoland" ''Financial Times''][https://www.nytimes.com/2007/02/23/business/worldbusiness/23iht-wbspot24.4698908.html?_r=0 "Ever-obsessive, Lapo Elkann returns with no apologies"], Peter Kiefer, Feb. 23, 2007, NY Times In 2007 he founded Independent Ideas, a communication and advertising agency.[http://www.independentideas.it/dl/INDEPENDENTideas_book.pdf "Independent Ideas Portfolio"]{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In 2011, Elkann worked with [[Gucci]]'s creative director, [[Frida Giannini]], on developing the [[Fiat 500 (2007)#500 by Gucci|Gucci Special Edition]] of the Fiat 500 and has consulted with [[Ferrari]], running ''Ferrari Tailor Made'', which enables customers to customize their car. Still in 2011 Italia Independent and ToyWatch of [[Gianluca Vacchi]] presented a special edition of 1007 copies of watches called Unique Edition. In June 2013 Elkann listed Italia Independent on the [[Milan Stock Exchange]].{{cite news|last=Sanderson |first=Rachel |url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/2dc2dee6-df36-11e2-a9f4-00144feab7de.html#axzz2XprvIt9u |title=Lapo Elkann’s Italia Independent set for Milan debut |publisher=FT.com |date=2013-06-27 |accessdate=2013-07-06}} He and his brother John had to reinvest in Italia Independent in 2017 after its share price plunged from €40 to €4.4 following disappointing sales and mismanagement.{{Cite news|url=https://www.ft.com/content/aed10ea4-424b-11e8-803a-295c97e6fd0b|title=Fiat scion aims to bring back 'roaring 50s' luxury|last=Sanderson|first=Rachel|date=20 April 2018|work=Financial Times|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}} ==Legal issues== In October 2006, [[Mark Seal]] wrote in ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'' that Elkann "had been found naked and unconscious in the apartment of Donato Broco, a 53-year-old [[transsexual]] [[prostitute]] known as Patrizia."{{cite news|last1=Seal|first1=Mark|title=Driven by Dynasty|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/style/2006/02/lapo-elkann-overdose-fiat|accessdate=30 November 2016|publisher=Vanity Fair|date=Feb 2006}} He was brought to the hospital, where he was in a coma for three days. Police investigated him at the time for [[cocaine]] use and soliciting prostitution. On November 27, 2016 in New York, Elkann was arrested for making a false police report claiming that he had been [[Unlawful imprisonment|unlawfully imprisoned]].{{cite news|last1=Pianigiani|first1=Gaia|last2=Rojas|first2=Rick|title=Lapo Elkann, Italian Scion and Fashion Designer, Is Arrested in Manhattan|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/29/style/lapo-elkann-fiat-fashion-designer-arrested.html|accessdate=30 November 2016|work=The New York Times|date=29 November 2016}} He had previously contacted his family, stating that he would "be harmed" if they did not pay a $10,000 ransom. He was accompanied by a transsexual escort who was also arrested.{{cite news|last1=Snavely|first1=Brent|title=Fiat heir Lapo Elkann arrested after allegedly faking his own kidnapping|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/cars/2016/11/29/fiat-lap-elkann-kidnapping/94603172/|accessdate=1 December 2016|work=USA Today|date=29 November 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Parascandola|first1=Rocco|last2=Annese|first2=John|title=Grandson of ex-Fiat CEO faked own kidnapping after he and transgender escort ran out of cash|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/manhattan/grandson-ex-fiat-ceo-faked-kidnapping-10g-ransom-article-1.2890490|accessdate=1 December 2016|work=New York Daily News|issue=28 November 2016}} Charges against the escort were later dropped.{{cite news|last1=Kirchgaessner|first1=Stephanie|title=Lapo Elkann, scion of powerful Agnelli family, charged with faking own kidnap|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/nov/29/lapo-elkann-agnelli-family-faking-kidnap-fiat|accessdate=1 December 2016|work=The Guardian|date=29 November 2016}} ==Awards and honors== [[Vanity Fair (magazine)|''Vanity Fair'']] magazine listed Elkann in its [[International Best Dressed List]] in 2008, and added him to its Best Dressed Hall of Fame in 2009.[http://www.vanityfair.com/style/features/2008/09/bestdressed_slideshow200809?slide=15#slide=15 ''Vanity Fair'', September 2008] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091201013644/http://www.vanityfair.com/style/features/2008/09/bestdressed_slideshow200809?slide=15#slide=15 |date=December 1, 2009 }}[http://www.vanityfair.com/style/2014/09/international-best-dressed-hall-of-fame "The International Best-Dressed List Hall of Fame 2014"], Theresa Grill, August 2014, "Vanity Fair" ==Art Collection== Lapo Elkann is an art lover with an impressive collection of contemporary art including original paintings by [[Andy Warhol]], [[Jean-Michel Basquiat]], [[Damien Hirst]], [[Roy Lichtenstein]] and rising contemporary artists including British artists [[Teddy M]] and [[Denimu|Ian Berry]] who made his portrait out of denim{{Cite news|url=http://dujour.com/gallery/theyve-been-framed-celebrity-portraits/#slide-8|title=Painted Celebrity Portraits - DuJour|work=DuJour|access-date=2018-06-29|language=en-US}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/article/teddy-m-royal-love|title=Teddy M on the creation of 'Royal Love' with the Duchess of York and Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie|first=Conrad|last=Quilty-Harper|publisher=|accessdate=10 January 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wiltsglosstandard.co.uk/news/14352081.Talented_Cotswold_artist_sells_two_works_to_Fiat_heir_and_art_collector_Lapo_Elkann/|title=Talented Cotswold artist sells two works to Fiat heir and art collector Lapo Elkann|website=Wilts and Gloucestershire Standard|accessdate=10 January 2018}}. ==Ancestry== {{ahnentafel |collapsed=yes |align=center |boxstyle_1=background-color: #fcc; |boxstyle_2=background-color: #fb9; |boxstyle_3=background-color: #ffc; |boxstyle_4=background-color: #bfc; |boxstyle_5=background-color: #9fe; |1= 1. '''Lapo Elkann''' |2= 2. [[Alain Elkann]] |3= 3. Margherita [[Agnelli family|Agnelli]] |4= 4. Jean-Paul Elkann |5= 5. Carla Ovazza |6= 6. [[Gianni Agnelli|Giovanni Agnelli]] |7= 7. Alice Chandler }} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.motortrend.com/features/consumer/112_0512_lapo_elkann_interview/ Interview - Lapo Elkann, Fiat's head of brand promotions] *[http://www.ft.com/cms/s/4c124ffc-a181-11db-8bc1-0000779e2340.html Interview - Lunch with the FT: Lapo Elkann] *[http://www.iht.com/articles/2007/01/08/opinion/flapo.php Interview - A new definition of Italian luxury] *[http://www.italiaindependent.it/ Website - Italia Independent] *[http://www.independentideas.it/ Website - Independent Ideas] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Elkann, Lapo}} [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:Agnelli family]] [[Category:Fiat people]] [[Category:Italian businesspeople]] [[Category:Italian people of American descent]] [[Category:Italian people of French-Jewish descent]] [[Category:Italian people of Jewish descent]] [[Category:Italian socialites]] [[Category:Italian Jews]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Businesspeople from New York City]] [[Category:People of Piedmontese descent]]

revision.text:
In [[international finance]], '''leads and lags''' refer to the expediting or delaying, respectively, of settlement of payments or receipts in a foreign exchange transaction because of an expected change in exchange rates.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/leadsandlags.asp |title=Investpedia, Leads and lags |accessdate=2015-08-05}}</ref><ref name="Mehmet 2015">{{cite book |author = Mehmet Odekon |publisher = Routledge |title = Booms and Busts: An Encyclopedia of Economic History from the First Stock Market Crash of 1792 to the Current Global Economic Crisis |url = https://books.google.co.jp/books?id=q_FnBwAAQBAJ&pg=PA467&dq=%22Leads+and+lags%22&hl=fr&sa=X&ved=0CE0Q6AEwB2oVChMIzMatxraQxwIVizgUCh1WcAFQ#v=onepage&q=%22Leads%20and%20lags%22&f=false |year = 2015 |page = 467 }}</ref> A change in exchange rates can be a cause of loss (or gain) in international trade, thus the settlement of debts is expedited or delayed in an attempt to minimize the loss or to maximize the gain. In the leads and lags, the premature payment for goods purchased is called a "lead," while the delayed payment is called a "lag."<ref name="Mehmet 2015" />
== Description == A change in exchange rates can be a cause of loss (or gain) in international trade. For example, now, we suppose that the [[euro]] to [[U.S. dollar]] exchange rate is 1.00 (€1.00 buys one dollar). In addition, we suppose that an importer of U.S. buys goods for €1000 from a European exporter and the U.S. importer will pay the money 1 month later. If the euro to U.S. dollar exchange rate is 2.00 one month later, the U.S. importer must prepare €1000 with $2000 in the [[foreign exchange market]] for the payment. On the other hand, If the euro to U.S. dollar exchange rate is 0.50 one month later, the U.S. importer is able to prepare €1000 with $500 for the payment.
Thus, if a rise in the exchange rates is expected in the future, the buyer may delay the payment of goods because such a delay can make purchasing the goods less costly.<ref name="Mehmet 2015" /> Conversely, if a decline in the exchange rates is expected in the future, the buyer may pay ahead of time to minimize the loss.<ref name="Mehmet 2015" />
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:International finance]] [[Category:International trade]]

revision.text:
[[File:Milk Bottles of the Late 19th century.jpg|thumb|230px|right|Examples of [[milk bottle]]s from the late 19th century made by the Warren Glass Works Company]]
This is a '''list of bottle types, brands and companies'''. A [[bottle]] is a rigid [[Food storage container|container]] with a neck that is narrower than the body, and a "mouth". Bottles are often made of [[glass]], [[clay]], [[plastic]], [[aluminum]] or other impervious materials, and are typically used to store [[liquid]]s. The bottle has developed over millennia of use, with some of the earliest examples appearing in [[China]], [[Phoenicia]], [[Rome]] and [[Crete]]. Bottles are often [[recycle]]d according to the SPI [[recycling code]] for the material. Some regions have a [[container deposit legislation|container deposit]] which is refunded after returning the bottle to the retailer.
{{Compact ToC|center=yes|align=center|seealso=yes|notesfirst=|extlinks=no|refs=yes|sep=·}}
==A== * [[Aluminum bottle]]<ref>{{cite web | url=https://aiche.confex.com/aiche/2005/techprogram/P39190.HTM | title=Aluminum Vs. Glass... revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2017}} '''Lois Dorothy Daish''' {{post-nominals|country=NZL|MNZM}} is a [[New Zealand]] restaurateur, food writer and cookbook author.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.bite.co.nz/our-people/518/Lois-Daish/|title=Lois Daish – Food writers, chefs, cooks and foodies in the talented Bite team – Bite|website=www.bite.co.nz|access-date=28 October 2016}}</ref> [[File:Cover of Dinner at Home by Lois Daish.jpg|thumb|''Dinner at Home'' (1993) by Lois Daish]]
== Biography == Daish was born in [[Wellington]], New Zealand and grew up in the suburb of [[Roseneath, Wellington|Roseneath.]] While young, her family moved to New York for two years as her father had a job at the United Nations.<ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/dominion-post/news/local-papers/the-wellingtonian/3119501/The-Wellingtonian-interview-Lois-Daish|title=The Wellingtonian interview: Lois Daish|last=Romanos|first=Joseph|date=3 December 2009|newspaper=Stuff.co.nz|language=English|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> This early exposure to American food influenced her interest and taste in food in later years.<ref name=":0" />
In the 1960s, Daish cooked at the [[Downstage Theatre]], and later worked at a bohemian cafe, The Settlement.<ref name=":2" />
In the 1970s, Daish wrote articles for a friend's newspaper in the western suburbs of Wellington; most were on town planning issues, but Daish convinced her friend to include a food column and she wrote food articles for the newspaper as well.<ref name=":2" />
In the 1980s, Daish owned several Wellington restaurants: Number 9 on Bowen St for four years, followed by the Mount Cook Café from 1984 to 1989, and then the Brooklyn Café & Grill.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":1" /> In 1984 she began writing a food column for the ''[[New Zealand Listener]]'' magazine. For the first ten years she wrote alternate weeks with [[Annabel Langbein]], and from 1994 she wrote the column every week.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=http://www.pageandblackmore.co.nz/product/62996-NZListenerAGoodYear-9781869416904|title=NZ Listener: A Good Year by Lois Daish {{!}} Page & Blackmore Booksellers|last=CircleSoft|website=Page & Blackmore Booksellers|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> She retired from the ''Listener'' in 2009.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.womensweekly.co.nz/latest/celebrity/nici-wickes-an-afternoon-with-my-hero-18782|title=Nici Wickes: An afternoon with my hero|newspaper=New Zealand Women’s Weekly|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> In 1987, she was a founding member of the New Zealand Guild of Food Writers.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://wellington.scoop.co.nz/?p=25731|title=Wellington.scoop.co.nz » New Zealand food writers honour Lois Daish|website=wellington.scoop.co.nz|language=en|access-date=28 October 2016}}</ref>
=== Publications === * ''Good Food: Recipes from the Listener'' (1989), {{ISBN|9780908833016}}<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://www.eatyourbooks.com/authors/32061/lois-daish|title=Lois Daish Cookbooks, Recipes and Biography {{!}} Eat Your Books|website=www.eatyourbooks.com|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> * ''Dinner at Home'' (1993), co-written with Geoffrey Notman, [[Bridget Williams Books]], {{ISBN|9780908912452}}<ref name=":4" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.abebooks.com/book-search/isbn/0908912455/|title=0908912455 – Dinner at Home by Lois Daish and Geoffrey Notman – AbeBooks|website=www.abebooks.com|access-date=29 October 2016}}</ref> * ''Fuss-Free Food for Two'' (1997), {{ISBN|9780908808809}}<ref name=":4" /> * ''A Good Year'' (2005), [[Random House New Zealand]], {{ISBN|9781869416904}}<ref name=":3" />
=== Awards and recognition === In the [[1997 New Year Honours]], Daish was made a [[Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit]]. In 2010, she was elected a life member of the New Zealand Guild of Food Writers.<ref name=":1" />
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Authority control}}
